description: IR Remote Button Mapping Configuration for Luma Mirror
note: Supports short press and long press (2 seconds) actions

KEY_UP.description: Navigate up / Move widget up (hold for 2s: Next widget)

KEY_DOWN.description: Navigate down / Move widget down (hold for 2s: Previous widget)

KEY_LEFT.description: Navigate left / Move widget left (hold for 2s: BACK)

KEY_0.description: Decrease brightness (numeric key for simple remotes)

KEY_1.description: Increase brightness (numeric key for simple remotes)

simpleMediaRemote.description: Simple IR remote (like ELEGOO remote) - uses long press for BACK and CHANNEL functions

notes: Button names (e.g., KEY_POWER) come from LIRC and are defined in your remote's configuration file
Long press functionality: Hold LEFT for 2s = BACK, Hold UP for 2s = CHANNEL_UP, Hold DOWN for 2s = CHANNEL_DOWN
Short press for normal navigation: UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT work as expected when pressed briefly
Brightness controls: Use VOL+/VOL- buttons or numeric keys 1/0
To customize mappings for your specific remote, edit server/ir-remote-server.js and restart the IR server
The 'action' field must match one of the button actions in the Luma app (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, OK, BACK, POWER, CHANNEL_UP, CHANNEL_DOWN, BRIGHTNESS_UP, BRIGHTNESS_DOWN)
